cancelling.title: You're about to cancel a campaign
cancelling.warning:
This campaign will not be executed on any further devices,
and will be moved to Finished.

details.cancel_tooltip: When you cancel a campaign, any update operations that are pending or already in progress will still complete. The campaign is canceled only for devices that haven't yet detected the new update.

campaigns.no_campaigns_yet: There aren't any campaigns yet. Try creating your first campaign.

retry.title: Confirm Retry
retry.header_1: For this campaign, retry all installations that failed due to the following error:
description_1: • OTA Connect retries installation on each devices once only.
• After this retry cycle is completed, you'll see fresh failure statistics for all installation attempts in this retry cycle.
• You cannot start a retry cycle for another error type before this retry cycle is finished.
• If a device is installing another update, this retry cycle will not apply to the device.
description_2: • You'll need to diagnose what's going wrong and possibly update your software.
• You can export the list of devices with failed installations to help with your analysis.
• Once you've figured it out, create another update and deploy it in another campaign.

wizard.automatically_publish_devices: Automatically publish to new matching devices
wizard.live_installation_progress_not_available: Live installation progress is not available for this update.
wizard.name: Name

user_consent.estimated_time_to_install_this_update: Estimated time to install this update:
user_consent.estimated_time_to_prepare_this_update: Estimated time to prepare this update:
user_consent.title: End user consent
user_consent.warning: Please, remember that you are responsible for the interaction with the end users and for asking necessary permissions and consents to install updates and collect personal information.

summary.title: Summary
summary.warning: Please, remember that the campaign will have an impact on your devices and that you are responsible for reviewing the campaign summary and ensuring that the campaign is properly configured before launching it.

legacy.login_error_desc: Sorry, we're experiencing some technical issues with user profiles. You might notice that the user profile menu is missing. If you encounter this issue, try logging in again in a few minutes.

no_items.action_devices: Find out how to provision more devices

devices.all_grouped: All your devices are grouped. Good work!
devices.delete_confirmation:
Remove {{device_name}} permanently?


When you delete a device, it is removed from the user interface and the update history is deleted, but you can still provision it again.


If the device is a part of any active campaigns, any devices that haven't installed it yet will fail the campaign.


This action cannot be undone.

empty.no_devices: You currently have no devices to manage. Try provisioning some devices first.

devices.empty_group_fixed: This group is empty. Please, drag and drop devices here.
devices.empty_group_smart: This smart group isn't matching any devices. Either provision some matching devices, or recreate the smart group with different filter settings.

hardware.no_hardware_reported: This device hasn’t reported any information about its hardware or system components yet.
secondary_ecus_description: In many connected mobility domains, most notably in automotive, it is common to have a device,
vehicle, or platform that has multiple independent micro-controllers or other devices networked together.
HERE OTA Connect is built to handle updates to those other micro-controllers even if they don't have an
internet connection, or are too resource-constrained to run a full updater client themselves.
The device that has a direct internet connection – the one running the HERE OTA Connect client
– is called the "Primary ECU", and is able to distribute firmware updates to
The term ECU comes from automotive, and stands for Electronic Control Unit.
If you don't have multiple devices to update from one primary/master device,
you don't need to worry about this functionality.
hardware.title: Hardware

approval_pending.cancel_tooltip_info: You can cancel an update as long as the device has not detected it yet. After the device has detected an update, you can no longer cancel it.
approval_pending.description: The device won't receive new updates until the end user has provided their consent. Wait until this update has finished before you launch another campaign.
approval_pending.estimated_time_to_install: Estimated time to install this update :
approval_pending.estimated_time_to_prepare: Estimated time to prepare this update
approval_pending.no_updates: There aren't any updates that are waiting for approval on this device.

history.no_updates: This device hasn't installed any updates yet.

properties.install_tooltip: If a device has multiple ECUs with the same type, all of these ECUs will get the update.
properties.installed_outside_ota_description: This software was installed outside of OTA Connect so there are no details to display.
properties.name: Name:
properties.select_package_description: Select the package version to see its details.

queue.description: Devices can't receive new updates when an update is still in progress. Wait until this update has finished before you launch another campaign.
queue.no_updates: There aren't any updates queued for this device.

software.automatic_update_tooltip: Automatic updates only get created when a new image is pushed while auto-updates are turned on; turning on auto-updates for a device will not trigger updates for any images that were already in the repository at the time auto-updating was activated.
software.auto_update_info: Automatic update activated. The latest version of this package will automatically be installed on this device.
software.title: Software

statistics.tooltip_failed: Devices where at least one update that failed to install for various reasons. For more details, see the reported failure codes.
statistics.tooltip_installing: Devices that are still installing one or more updates from this campaign.
statistics.tooltip_not_applicable: Devices where none of the ECUs or software versions match the targeting criteria of the update. Can also indicate devices that are busy installing updates from another campaign.
statistics.tooltip_success: Devices that have successfully installed their updates.

file_uploading.description: You can import a list of device IDs that you want to add to a fixed group. To use this feature, you'll need to configure your own device IDs and provision the devices first. You can find out how to configure your own device IDs in the

creating.fixed_group_teaser: A group that contains a fixed list of devices. To add devices, you drag and drop them from the device view.
creating.smart_group_teaser: A group that is based on a device filter. New devices are automatically added if they match the filter criteria.
creating.smart_group_description_1: You can filter for devices based on the device ID. The device ID is defined in the OTA Connect client configuration. If no ID is configured for the device, OTA Connect automatically generates one for you. However, this feature works best when you preconfigure your own IDs such as device serial numbers. For more information about configuring the device ID, see the
creating.title: Group Name

organization.members_description: People you add here must have an OTA Connect account. If you are unsure check with that person first. People in this list can collaborate on campaigns with other members in the organization. Please, remember that the device details may contain personal information and will be visible to all added members collaborating in your organization. Ensure that they have the legal right to access this information.
organization.name: Organization Name
organization.name_description: Select your active organization. When you select an organization, the OTA Connect portal will reload and show the details for the selected organization.

provisioning_keys.no_keys_description: There aren't any keys yet. Try creating your first key. If this is a new account, it may take some time to generate the keys for your repository.

blacklist_modal.bottom_text: On the Impact analysis tab, you can view which of your devices already have the blacklisted version of the package installed, letting you proactivly troubleshoot and update those devices to a fixed version, or roll them back to an older version.
blacklist_modal.title: Blacklist
blacklist_modal.top_text: With HERE OTA Connect, you can blacklist problem packages, ensuring they won’t get installed on any of your devices.

multiple.title: Cancel all uploads?
multiple.warning: Your uploads are not complete. Would you like to cancel all ongoing uploads?

single.title: Cancel upload?
single.warning: Your upload is not complete. Would you like to cancel the upload?

create_modal.file_information: The file can be in any installable format.
create_modal.intro_1: Upload new software versions to your software repository. Alternatively, you can also use the
create_modal.intro_2: to build and upload full software images. Please, remember that you are responsible for the content of the software versions and for their impact on the devices. Ensure that you have tested them accordingly and that you can provide necessary support for your end users.
create_modal.title: Add new software

warnings.bottom: If the software is part of any active campaigns, any devices that haven't installed it will fail the campaign.
warnings.top: All software versions will be removed.

delete_soft_version.bottom_text: If the software is part of any active campaigns, any devices that haven't installed it will fail the campaign.

empty.no_software: You haven't created any software yet.

software.not_installed: This software has not been installed yet.

creating.description: An update is a list of instructions that you can later use in a campaign. These instructions specify the ECU types and software versions that should be updated. Before you continue, make sure that you've provisioned some target devices and uploaded your new software versions.

wizard.select_ecu_types_description: If a device has multiple ECUs with the same type, all of these ECUs will get the update.

sizeverify.description_1: HERE OTA Connect works best in a browser window that is at least {{width}} x {{height}}.
sizeverify.description_2: You can still use it at a smaller size, but we recommend using a desktop browser for the best experience.
sizeverify.title: Tip
